title: Bees Roux
text:
Jacobus Stephanus "Bees" Roux (born 9 December 1981 in Upington) is a South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player, currently playing with . His regular position is prop.
Career.
He started his playing career at the and represented them in the <a href="Vodacom%20Cup">Vodacom Cup</a> and <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a> competitions in 2005 and 2006, making over 40 appearances.
In 2007, he joined <a href="Kimberley%2C%20Northern%20Cape">Kimberley</a>-based side , where he played his rugby over the next three seasons. During his spell at Griquas, he also played <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> for the , making seventeen appearances for them in the <a href="2008%20Super%2014%20season">2008</a> and <a href="2009%20Super%2014%20season">2009 season</a>s. He also spent the off-season at the end of 2008 playing some rugby for French <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a> side <a href="ASM%20Clermont%20Auvergne">Clermont</a>, appearing in both the Top 14 and <a href="Heineken%20Cup">Heineken Cup</a> competitions.
He joined the in 2010, making eight appearances for them, as well as fourteen appearances for the in the <a href="2010%20Super%2014%20season">2010 Super 14 season</a>.
In August 2010, Roux assaulted police officer Sergeant Ntshimane Johannes Mogale, killing him. He was charged with murder, but in a plea bargain agreement, was convicted of culpable homicide and given a five-year prison sentence in September 2011, suspended on the condition that he paid R750 000 to the widow of the police officer.
He continued his career in France, joining <a href="Union%20Bordeaux%20B%C3%A8gles">Bordeaux Bègles</a> for the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Top%2014%20season">2011–12 Top 14 season</a> and then playing for Italian side <a href="Benetton%20Rugby">Benetton Treviso</a> in the <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Pro%2012">2012–13 Pro 12</a> competition.
He returned to South Africa in 2013 and joined the for the <a href="2013%20Currie%20Cup%20Premier%20Division">2013 Currie Cup Premier Division</a> and he was named in their starting line-up for their match against the .
However, he failed to feature regularly for the <a href="Johannesburg">Johannesburg</a>-based side and joined the for the <a href="2014%20Currie%20Cup%20Premier%20Division">2014 Currie Cup Premier Division</a>.
Representative rugby.
He also played for a <a href="Highveld%20XV">Highveld XV</a> team against the <a href="British%20%26amp%3B%20Irish%20Lions">British & Irish Lions</a> during their <a href="2009%20British%20%26amp%3B%20Irish%20Lions%20tour%20to%20South%20Africa">tour to South Africa</a>, starting the match and scoring a try.
